channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Ireland's PM urged everyone to restrict visitors to their homes, avoid public transport and told older people to limit their contacts following a spike in infections.
item.title: Ireland significantly tightens nationwide COVID-19 restrictions

item.description: A UN-backed tribunal has convicted a member of Iran-backed Hezbollah of conspiring to kill former Lebanese Prime Minister Rafik al-Hariri in a 2005 bombing.
item.title: UN tribunal convicts Hezbollah defendant in Hariri assassination case

item.description: The uprising began with gunshots at an army base and tactical vehicles rolling into the capital, stoking concerns of an attempted coup in the West African nation.
item.title: Gunfire heard at Mali army base as leaders condemn 'military mutiny'

item.description: WikiLeaks also played a key role in Russia's effort to assist Donald Trump against Hillary Clinton and likely knew it was helping Russian intelligence, the report concluded.
item.title: Putin ordered Democratic hack to boost Trump in 2016, Senate committee finds

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 19, 2020

item.dc:creator: Daisy Turnbull
item.description: This has been a year of constant unknowns, depriving students of the rites of passage that help them shape their identities.
item.title: I mourn the loss of rituals for year 12

item.dc:creator: Chris Uhlmann
item.description: Borders closed and Australians banned from overseas travel - an East German zeitgeist has now taken hold nationwide.
item.title: This pandemic has revealed the authoritarian streak in Australian governments

item.description: Australia is one of few industrialised countries not to have a vaccine injury compensation scheme already in place.
item.title: Vaccine injury compensation is the moral thing to do

item.description: The Premier cancels year 12 formals and graduation dinners. Meanwhile, NSW schools are not required to enforce social distancing. Go figure?
item.title: Safety rules for schools are enough to confuse anyone

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: The Thai Rock restaurants cluster is NSW’s biggest since Victoria’s hotel quarantine breaches foisted a second wave upon both states.
item.title: Supercluster confirmed as genetic fingerprint links two outbreaks 34km apart

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: One band conductor says there are "glaring inconsistencies" in telling adults they can drink at pubs, but stopping kids from playing in concert bands
item.title: 'A bridge too far': Concern about bans to music programs in schools

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Another season of mass fish-kills looms across the Murray-Darling Basin unless more water is released into the system.
item.title: Threat of more mass fish-kills across Murray-Darling Basin

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: In the year to date 14 people - including three children - have died riding quad bikes on Australian farms.
item.title: Quad bikes fatality spike 'incredibly concerning': consumer watchdog

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: Anyone who thinks they know what the Storm captain is doing next season is guessing, but some question if joining the Broncos is the right move.
item.title: Smith could easily end his career at the broken Broncos – but he shouldn't

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Australia's electric vehicle strategy needs to be energised or consumers will miss the benefits of a global technology shift, the industry's lobby says.
item.title: Electric vehicle policy attracts 'dirty vehicles' to Australia: report

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Hannah Clarke's parents hope new laws can be introduced to State Parliament to address coercive control.
item.title: No new domestic violence reforms six months on from Clarke tragedy

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: Politicians have been tempting us to put our immediate interests ahead of our offspring’s future – and it’s worked a treat.
item.title: We've been electing governments that damage our children's future

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: The federal government's $50 million Temporary Interruption Fund is designed to fill the gap in the insurance market that has arisen as a result of COVID-19.
item.title: 'Everyone is very keen': funding set to kickstart Aussie film production

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, August 19

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Technology giant Oracle is said to be in negotiations to buy TikTok as it seeks to outbid Microsoft in the race to acquire the viral social media platform.
item.title: Oracle said to be in negotiations to buy TikTok

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Plans to allow automatic recognition of tradespeople in different states have raised concerns about inconsistent safety standards from both employers and unions.
item.title: Cutting red tape should not be 'shorthand for cutting corners', tradies warn

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: The Nationals' Regional Education Minister has predicted the government will wind back some proposed university fee hikes after his extraordinary criticism.
item.title: Maverick Nationals minister 'confident' government will change uni legislation

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Melbourne-based Buildkite is now valued at $200 million after US funds OpenView and General Catalyst lead the company's latest funding round.
item.title: Software startup Buildkite scores $28 million investment

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: See how many students were suspended and expelled from every state school in Queensland.
item.title: Queensland schools with most student suspensions revealed

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: With the rise in online shopping and need for increased data storage as people work from home, demand for industrial property is on a strong upward trajectory.
item.title: Industrial property deals worth $81m to test the market

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Four roads are set to be closed permanently to through traffic to stop motorists funnelled from WestConnex tunnels using them as short cuts.
item.title: Inner Sydney roads closed to stop Westconnex rat runs

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bull
item.description: Airlines declare war, protestor walks free (with conditions), and bathing briefings.
item.title: In the Herald: August 19, 1989

item.description: As tensions in the Gulf escalated and Iraqi President Saddam Hussein issued direct threats against Australians, families of Telecom workers based in Saudi Arabia arrived home to an emotional welcome from relatives.
item.title: From the Archives, 1990: Telecom workers return as Saddam threatens Australians

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: Elbow bumps were hysterical, until they weren't. Now, as the months drag on, we’re realising there is a whole medley of once normal behaviours that we might be saying goodbye to for a very long time.
item.title: From patting dogs to thumbing avocados: Things the pandemic has ruined

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: It is not often a court strongly discourages litigation, but the family courts are far from typical courts.
item.title: The 'profound shift' under way in Australia's family law courts

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Former High Court judge Dyson Heydon has relinquished a prestigious international post amid sexual harassment findings.
item.title: Hat's that folks as Heydon gets the Oxford blues

item.description: One of the reasons the mental health system is vulnerable is because shared funding between state and federal governments leaves large gaps.
item.title: 'Missing middle' leaves too many Victorians without mental health support

item.dc:creator: John Collett
item.description: Fund manager Paul Moore says March and early April was one of the best buying opportunities in his 35-year career and that investors should not get "fixated" on the macro economic outlook.
item.title: COVID-19 crisis generational buying opportunity for stocks

item.description: An entire generation has grown up barking orders and insults at female-gendered smart speakers that are designed to be subservient.
item.title: It's time to voice a gender problem over Siri, Alexa

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: An expert medical panel will decide which Australians will get a coronavirus vaccine first as the Morrison government agrees to buy the Oxford vaccine if it works.
item.title: Free dose for every Aussie: Agreement to buy Oxford vaccine if it works

item.dc:creator: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon
item.description: A fall in the numbers of people buying homes – and borrowing – also has lenders aggressively vying to steal market share from rivals.
item.title: Step-by-step guide to finding the best mortgage rate

item.description: Seeing the chance for a quick buck, sharks and rip-off merchants have moved into the market.
item.title: How to avoid being ripped off when buying your pandemic essentials

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: More people are paying by waving their phones at retailers' terminals while tap-and-go plastic card transactions are in decline.
item.title: Smartphone payments soar as digital wallets gain traction

item.dc:creator: Noel Whittaker
item.description: Ten-year Commonwealth government bonds pay interest of less than 1 per cent a year - there are better places to park your money.
item.title: Weigh up the pros and cons of a lifetime annuity

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Kevin Proctor has been found guilty of biting Shaun Johnson and suspended four weeks, despite Johnson himself giving evidence at the marathon hearing.
item.title: Proctor found guilty of biting Johnson, cops four-week ban

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.dc:creator: John Collett
item.description: The reduction in the number of financial planners shows no signs of abating, with higher education standards, low salary expectations and limited job opportunities cited as reasons for leaving the industry.
item.title: Professionals exit but demand for financial advice still strong

item.dc:creator: John Collett
item.description: Daily trading volumes have soared during the pandemic as inexperienced investors fear missing out on what they perceive as bargains. However, history is against them successfully timing the market.
item.title: Rookie investors warned against short-term market trading strategy

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: NSW Swifts overcame a late Firebirds fightback to hang on to a six point win.
item.title: NSW Swifts beat Firebirds to move back to the summit

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: The Vixens bounced back from their loss on Sunday with a win over West Coast Fever on Tuesday night.
item.title: Melbourne Vixens bounce back to shoot past West Coast Fever

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: But most have no beef with it.
item.title: Meat attire has us going Gaga
